columns.dc:description: The name of the organisation to which the pay multiple data relates.
A Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) which identifies the organisation.
Date at which the information provided is true, in the ISO international date format YYYY-MM-DD.
Factor that is used to calculate the pay multiple: 'Median', 'Mean', 'Lowest' and 'Highest' remuneration pay. The use of 'Median' and 'Highest' is mandatory, the other factors are optional.
Remuneration value in GBP for the pay multiple factor.

The ratio is the highest earned remuneration divided by the pay multiple factor. The Transparency Code mandates to show the pay multiple for the median remuneration, i.e Highest:Median. Shown as numeric ratio.
The financial year for which the pay multiple is calculated in the format YYYY/YY.

Code from 0 - 4 to specify what factor was used to calculate the ratio, to meet the requirement of www.paycompare.org.uk. 0 = Unreported or otherwise uncertain, 1 = Highest:Median of whole workforce, 2 = Highest:Median of non-chief officers, 3 = Highest:Mean of whole workforce, 4 = Highest:lowest.
Abbreviation to specify type of public organisation. MBC = Metropolitan Borough Council.
